intro: Allardia transalaica, commonly known as the Transalpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Allardia transalaica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in alpine meadows.
